org.apache.juneau.jena

Class RdfSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Lockable
      • org.apache.juneau.CoreApi
        • org.apache.juneau.serializer.Serializer
          • org.apache.juneau.serializer.WriterSerializer
            • org.apache.juneau.jena.RdfSerializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RdfSerializer.N3, RdfSerializer.NTriple, RdfSerializer.Turtle, RdfSerializer.Xml, RdfSerializer.XmlAbbrev

    @Produces(value="text/xml+rdf+abbrev",
          contentType="text/xml+rdf")
public class RdfSerializer
extends WriterSerializer
    Serializes POJOs to RDF.
    Configurable properties:

    Refer to Configurable Properties for the entire list of configurable properties.

    Behavior-specific subclasses

    The following direct subclasses are provided for language-specific serializers:

    • RdfSerializer.Xml - RDF/XML.
    • RdfSerializer.XmlAbbrev - RDF/XML-ABBREV.
    • RdfSerializer.NTriple - N-TRIPLE.
    • RdfSerializer.Turtle - TURTLE.
    • RdfSerializer.N3 - N3.
    Additional information:

    See RDF Overview for an overview of RDF support in Juneau.

      • doSerialize

        protected void doSerialize(SerializerSession session,
                           Object o)
                    throws Exception
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Serializes a POJO to the specified output stream or writer.

        This method should NOT close the context object.

        Specified by:
        doSerialize in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        session - The serializer session object return by Serializer.createSession(Object, ObjectMap, Method, Locale, TimeZone, MediaType).
        If null, session is created using Serializer.createSession(Object).
        o - The object to serialize.
        Throws:
        Exception - If thrown from underlying stream, or if the input contains a syntax error or is malformed.

      • createSession

        public RdfSerializerSession createSession(Object output,
                                          ObjectMap op,
                                          Method javaMethod,
                                          Locale locale,
                                          TimeZone timeZone,
                                          MediaType mediaType)
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Create the session object that will be passed in to the serialize method.

        It's up to implementers to decide what the session object looks like, although typically it's going to be a subclass of SerializerSession.

        Overrides:
        createSession in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        output - The output object.
        Character-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
        • Writer
        • OutputStream - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
        • File - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.

        Stream-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
        • OutputStream
        • File
        op - Optional additional properties.
        javaMethod - Java method that invoked this serializer. When using the REST API, this is the Java method invoked by the REST call. Can be used to access annotations defined on the method or class.
        locale - The session locale. If null, then the locale defined on the context is used.
        timeZone - The session timezone. If null, then the timezone defined on the context is used.
        mediaType - The session media type (e.g. "application/json").
        Returns:
        The new session.

      • setLanguage

        public RdfSerializer setLanguage(String value)
                          throws LockedException
        Configuration property: RDF language.

        • Name: "Rdf.language"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "RDF/XML-ABBREV"

        Can be any of the following:

        • "RDF/XML"
        • "RDF/XML-ABBREV"
        • "N-TRIPLE"
        • "N3" - General name for the N3 writer. Will make a decision on exactly which writer to use (pretty writer, plain writer or simple writer) when created. Default is the pretty writer but can be overridden with system property com.hp.hpl.jena.n3.N3JenaWriter.writer.
        • "N3-PP" - Name of the N3 pretty writer. The pretty writer uses a frame-like layout, with prefixing, clustering like properties and embedding one-referenced bNodes.
        • "N3-PLAIN" - Name of the N3 plain writer. The plain writer writes records by subject.
        • "N3-TRIPLES" - Name of the N3 triples writer. This writer writes one line per statement, like N-Triples, but does N3-style prefixing.
        • "TURTLE" - Turtle writer. http://www.dajobe.org/2004/01/turtle/

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(RDF_language, value).
        • This introduces a slight performance penalty.
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        RdfCommonContext.RDF_language

      • setUseXmlNamespaces

        public RdfSerializer setUseXmlNamespaces(boolean value)
                                  throws LockedException
        Configuration property: Reuse XML namespaces when RDF namespaces not specified.

        • Name: "Rdf.useXmlNamespaces"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: true

        When specified, namespaces defined using XmlNs and RdfSerializer.Xml will be inherited by the RDF serializers. Otherwise, namespaces will be defined using RdfNs and Rdf.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(RDF_useXmlNamespaces, value).
        • This introduces a slight performance penalty.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_sortMaps

      • setAddRootProperty

        public RdfSerializer setAddRootProperty(boolean value)
                                 throws LockedException
        Configuration property: Add RDF root identifier property to root node.

        • Name: "RdfSerializer.addRootProperty"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: true

        When enabled an RDF property http://www.apache.org/juneau/root is added with a value of "true" to identify the root node in the graph. This helps locate the root node during parsing.

        If disabled, the parser has to search through the model to find any resources without incoming predicates to identify root notes, which can introduce a considerable performance degradation.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(RDF_addRootProperty, value).
        • This introduces a slight performance penalty.
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        RdfSerializerContext.RDF_addRootProperty

      • setAutoDetectNamespaces

        public RdfSerializer setAutoDetectNamespaces(boolean value)
                                      throws LockedException
        Configuration property: Auto-detect namespace usage.

        • Name: "RdfSerializer.autoDetectNamespaces"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: true
        • Session-overridable: true

        Detect namespace usage before serialization.

        If enabled, then the data structure will first be crawled looking for namespaces that will be encountered before the root element is serialized.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(RDF_autoDetectNamespaces, value).
        • This introduces a slight performance penalty.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:

        See Also:

      • setCollectionFormat

        public RdfSerializer setCollectionFormat(RdfCollectionFormat value)
                                  throws LockedException
        Configuration property: RDF format for representing collections and arrays.

        • Name: "Rdf.collectionFormat"
        • Data type: RdfCollectionFormat
        • Default: "DEFAULT"

        Possible values:

        • "DEFAULT" - Default format. The default is an RDF Sequence container.
        • "SEQ" - RDF Sequence container.
        • "BAG" - RDF Bag container.
        • "LIST" - RDF List container.
        • "MULTI_VALUED" - Multi-valued properties.

        Notes:
        • If you use "BAG" or "MULTI_VALUED", the order of the elements in the collection will get lost.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(RDF_collectionFormat, value).
        • This introduces a slight performance penalty.
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        RdfCommonContext.RDF_collectionFormat

      • setLooseCollections

        public RdfSerializer setLooseCollections(boolean value)
                                  throws LockedException
        Configuration property: Collections should be serialized and parsed as loose collections.

        • Name: "Rdf.looseCollections"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false

        When specified, collections of resources are handled as loose collections of resources in RDF instead of resources that are children of an RDF collection (e.g. Sequence, Bag).

        Note that this setting is specialized for RDF syntax, and is incompatible with the concept of losslessly representing POJO models, since the tree structure of these POJO models are lost when serialized as loose collections.

        This setting is typically only useful if the beans being parsed into do not have a bean property annotated with @Rdf(beanUri=true).

        Example:

        WriterSerializer s = new RdfSerializer.XmlAbbrev().setLooseCollections(true); ReaderParser p = new RdfParser.Xml().setLooseCollections(true); List<MyBean> l = createListOfMyBeans(); // Serialize to RDF/XML as loose resources String rdfXml = s.serialize(l); // Parse back into a Java collection l = p.parse(rdfXml, LinkedList.class, MyBean.class); MyBean[] b = createArrayOfMyBeans(); // Serialize to RDF/XML as loose resources String rdfXml = s.serialize(b); // Parse back into a bean array b = p.parse(rdfXml, MyBean[].class);

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(RDF_looseCollections, value).
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        RdfCommonContext.RDF_looseCollections

      • setMaxDepth

        public RdfSerializer setMaxDepth(int value)
                          throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Configuration property: Max serialization depth.

        • Name: "Serializer.maxDepth"
        • Data type: Integer
        • Default: 100
        • Session-overridable: true

        Abort serialization if specified depth is reached in the POJO tree. If this depth is exceeded, an exception is thrown. This prevents stack overflows from occurring when trying to serialize models with recursive references.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(SERIALIZER_maxDepth, value).
        Overrides:
        setMaxDepth in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If Serializer.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_maxDepth

      • setDetectRecursions

        public RdfSerializer setDetectRecursions(boolean value)
                                  throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Configuration property: Automatically detect POJO recursions.

        • Name: "Serializer.detectRecursions"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: true

        Specifies that recursions should be checked for during serialization.

        Recursions can occur when serializing models that aren't true trees, but rather contain loops.

        The behavior when recursions are detected depends on the value for SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions.

        For example, if a model contains the links A->B->C->A, then the JSON generated will look like the following when SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions is true... {A:{B:{C:null}}}

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(SERIALIZER_detectRecursions, value).
        • Checking for recursion can cause a small performance penalty.
        Overrides:
        setDetectRecursions in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If Serializer.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_detectRecursions

      • setIgnoreRecursions

        public RdfSerializer setIgnoreRecursions(boolean value)
                                  throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Configuration property: Ignore recursion errors.

        • Name: "Serializer.ignoreRecursions"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: true

        Used in conjunction with SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_detectRecursions. Setting is ignored if SERIALIZER_detectRecursions is false.

        If true, when we encounter the same object when serializing a tree, we set the value to null. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions, value).
        • Checking for recursion can cause a small performance penalty.
        Overrides:
        setIgnoreRecursions in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If Serializer.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions

      • setAddBeanTypeProperties

        public RdfSerializer setAddBeanTypeProperties(boolean value)
                                       throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Configuration property: Add "_type" properties when needed.

        • Name: "Serializer.addBeanTypeProperties"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: true

        If true, then "_type" properties will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred through reflection. This is used to recreate the correct objects during parsing if the object types cannot be inferred. For example, when serializing a Map<String,Object> field, where the bean class cannot be determined from the value type.

        Notes:

      • setRelativeUriBase

        public RdfSerializer setRelativeUriBase(String value)
                                 throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Configuration property: URI base for relative URIs.

        • Name: "Serializer.relativeUriBase"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: ""
        • Session-overridable: true

        Prepended to relative URIs during serialization (along with the SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_absolutePathUriBase if specified. (i.e. URIs not containing a schema and not starting with '/'). (e.g. "foo/bar")

        Example:
        SERIALIZER_relativeUriBaseURISerialized URI
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz mywebapp http://foo:9080/bar/baz/mywebapp
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz /mywebapp /mywebapp
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz http://mywebapp http://mywebapp

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(SERIALIZER_relativeUriBase, value).
        Overrides:
        setRelativeUriBase in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If Serializer.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_relativeUriBase

      • setBeansRequireDefaultConstructor

        public RdfSerializer setBeansRequireDefaultConstructor(boolean value)
                                                throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: CoreApi
        Configuration property: Beans require no-arg constructors.

        • Name: "BeanContext.beansRequireDefaultConstructor"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: false

        If true, a Java class must implement a default no-arg constructor to be considered a bean. Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the Object.toString() method.

        The @Bean annotation can be used on a class to override this setting when true.

        public RdfSerializer setBeanFieldVisibility(Visibility value)
                                     throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: CoreApi
        Configuration property: Look for bean fields with the specified minimum visibility.

        • Name: "BeanContext.beanFieldVisibility"
        • Data type: Visibility
        • Default: Visibility.PUBLIC
        • Session-overridable: false

        Fields are not considered bean properties unless they meet the minimum visibility requirements. For example, if the visibility is PUBLIC and the bean field is protected, then the field will not be interpreted as a bean property.

        Notes:

        • Use Visibility.NONE to prevent bean fields from being interpreted as bean properties altogether.

      • setSortProperties

        public RdfSerializer setSortProperties(boolean value)
                                throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: CoreApi
        Configuration property: Sort bean properties in alphabetical order.

        • Name: "BeanContext.sortProperties"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: false

        When true, all bean properties will be serialized and access in alphabetical order. Otherwise, the natural order of the bean properties is used which is dependent on the JVM vendor. On IBM JVMs, the bean properties are ordered based on their ordering in the Java file. On Oracle JVMs, the bean properties are not ordered (which follows the offical JVM specs).

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(BEAN_sortProperties, value).
        • This property is disabled by default so that IBM JVM users don't have to use @Bean annotations to force bean properties to be in a particular order and can just alter the order of the fields/methods in the Java file.
        Overrides:
        setSortProperties in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If CoreApi.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        BeanContext.BEAN_sortProperties

      • setNotBeanPackages

        public RdfSerializer setNotBeanPackages(String... values)
                                 throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: CoreApi
        Configuration property: Packages whose classes should not be considered beans.

        • Name: "BeanContext.notBeanPackages.set"
        • Data type: Set<String>
        • Default:
          • java.lang
          • java.lang.annotation
          • java.lang.ref
          • java.lang.reflect
          • java.io
          • java.net
          • java.nio.*
          • java.util.*
        • Session-overridable: false

        When specified, the current list of ignore packages are appended to.

        Any classes within these packages will be serialized to strings using Object.toString().

        Note that you can specify prefix patterns to include all subpackages.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(BEAN_notBeanPackages, values).
        Overrides:
        setNotBeanPackages in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        values - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If CoreApi.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        BeanContext.BEAN_notBeanPackages

      • setBeanFilters

        public RdfSerializer setBeanFilters(Class<?>... values)
                             throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: CoreApi
        Configuration property: Bean filters to apply to beans.

        • Name: "BeanContext.beanFilters.list"
        • Data type: List<Class>
        • Default: empty list
        • Session-overridable: false

        This is a programmatic equivalent to the @Bean annotation. It's useful when you want to use the Bean annotation functionality, but you don't have the ability to alter the bean classes.

        There are two category of classes that can be passed in through this method:

        • Subclasses of BeanFilterBuilder. These must have a public no-arg constructor.
        • Bean interface classes. A shortcut for defining a InterfaceBeanFilterBuilder. Any subclasses of an interface class will only have properties defined on the interface. All other bean properties will be ignored.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(BEAN_beanFilters, values).
        Overrides:
        setBeanFilters in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        values - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If CoreApi.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters

      • setBeanDictionary

        public RdfSerializer setBeanDictionary(Class<?>... values)
                                throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: CoreApi
        Configuration property: Bean lookup dictionary.

        • Name: "BeanContext.beanDictionary.list"
        • Data type: List<Class>
        • Default: empty list
        • Session-overridable: false

        This list can consist of the following class types:

        • Any bean class that specifies a value for @Bean.typeName().
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryList containing a collection of bean classes with type name annotations.
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryMap containing a mapping of type names to classes without type name annotations.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(BEAN_beanDictionary, values).

      • setDebug

        public RdfSerializer setDebug(boolean value)
                       throws LockedException
        Description copied from class: CoreApi
        Configuration property: Debug mode.

        • Name: "BeanContext.debug"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: true

        Enables the following additional information during serialization:

        • When bean getters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information in order to determine how that method was invoked.
        • Enables SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_detectRecursions.

        Enables the following additional information during parsing:

        • When bean setters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information in order to determine how that method was invoked.

        Notes:
        • This is equivalent to calling setProperty(BEAN_debug, value).
        Overrides:
        setDebug in class Serializer
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        LockedException - If CoreApi.lock() was called on this class.
        See Also:
        BeanContext.BEAN_debug
